intro: Chondrilla piestocarpa var. scoparia, commonly known as the narrowleaf chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its spread in suitable habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
